required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Biomarker Study of EPI-589 in Participants With Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2A Safety and Biomarker Study of EPI-589 in Subjects With Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open label study with 30-day run in phase to establish baseline parameters, 90-day treatment phase, and a 90-day withdrawal phase to determine long-term effects, duration of treatment response, and potential effects of EPI-589 therapy on known trajectory.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Drug-Related Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. Serious adverse event (SAE) was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. AEs included both SAEs and non-serious AEs. A summary of other non-serious AEs and all SAEs, regardless of causality is located in the 'Reported AE section'.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time 0 to 12 Hours (AUC0-12)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (0 hour), 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours post-dose at Month 1 and 3
Pre-dose (0 hour), 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours post-dose at Month 1 and 3

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in ALSFRS-R Total Score at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: ALSFRS-R is a quickly administered (5 minutes) ordinal rating scale that assesses participant's capability and independence in 12 functional activities. All 12 activities, 6 bulbar-respiratory functions, 3 upper extremity functions (writing, cutting food, and dressing), 2 lower-extremity functions (walking and climbing), and 1 other function (turning in bed), are relevant in ALS. Each activity was recorded to the closest approximation from a list of 5 choices, scored 0-4, with the total score ranging from 48 (normal function) to 0 (unable to attempt the task).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Vital Capacity at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Vital capacity is the maximum amount of air a participant can expel from the lungs after a maximum inhalation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in MIP at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: MIP is a measure of the strength of inspiratory muscles, primarily the diaphragm, and allows for the assessment of ventilatory failure, restrictive lung disease, and respiratory muscle strength.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Respiratory Rate at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate is the rate at which breathing occurs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Heart Rate at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: The heart rate measures the number of times the heart beats per minute.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in SpO2 at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: SpO2, also known as oxygen saturation, is a measure of the amount of oxygen-carrying hemoglobin in the blood relative to the amount of hemoglobin not carrying oxygen.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in ETCO2 at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: ETCO2 is the amount of CO2 in exhaled air, which assesses ventilation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Failure to Thrive: Number of Participants With Weight Loss of More Than 5 Percent (%) From Baseline at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: The failure to thrive as measured by body weight was defined as weight loss of more than 5% from baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Average Solid Swallowing Time and Water Swallowing Time at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were observed and timed swallowing water as well as solid foods in accordance with a standardized protocol.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Muscle Function at Month 6, as Assessed by Handheld Dynamometry Parameters (Grip Strength, Shoulder Flexion, Knee Extension, Hip Flexion, Elbow Flexion, Elbow Extension, and Ankle Dorsi Flexion)
secondary_outcome.description: The strength of designated muscle groups was measured using handheld dynamometry.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Number of Words Participant Read at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: The participant performed tasks in which speech was assessed through a perceptual assessment of overall intelligibility, vocal quality, and other factors by a speech language pathologist.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Time Spent in Reading at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: The participant performed tasks in which speech was assessed through a perceptual assessment of overall intelligibility, vocal quality, and other factors by a speech language pathologist.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Number of Words Per Minute Read at Month 6
secondary_outcome.description: The participant performed tasks in which speech was assessed through a perceptual assessment of overall intelligibility, vocal quality, and other factors by a speech language pathologist.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Normal Loudness, Normal Nasality, and Normal Intelligibility
secondary_outcome.description: The participant performed tasks in which speech was assessed through a perceptual assessment of overall intelligibility, vocal quality, and other factors by a speech language pathologist.

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of Disease-Related Biomarker (Glutathione) in Plasma
secondary_outcome.description: Glutathione lowest limit of quantification (LLOQ) = 0.089 micromoles (uM) and upper limit of quantification (ULOQ) = 13.916 uM in plasma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of Disease-Related Biomarker (Glutathione) in Cerebrospinal Fluid (CSF)
secondary_outcome.description: Glutathione LLOQ = 0.002 uM and ULOQ = 0.35 uM in CSF.

secondary_outcome.measure: Level of Disease-Related Biomarker (Glutathione) in Urine
secondary_outcome.description: Glutathione LLOQ = 0.01 uM, and ULOQ = 1.39 uM in urine.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive EPI-589 500 milligrams (mg) (2 tablets of 250 mg each) twice daily (BID) for 3 months, unless discontinued for safety or tolerability issues.

intervention.description: An immediate release film-coated table at a 250 mg dosage strength will be administered per dose and schedule specified in arm.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of possible, probable, laboratory supported probable, or definite ALS by E1 Escorial Criteria
- Forced vital capacity (FVC) ≥ 70% of predicted
- Weakness onset within 3 years
- Agreement to use contraception if within reproductive years
- Willingness and ability to comply with study procedures
- Stable regimen of dietary supplements and /or riluzole for at least 30 days prior to enrollment
- Abstention from use of other investigative or non-approved drugs
- Participants must be able to swallow 0.375 * 0.700 inch tablets
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergy to EPI-589
- Use of ventilation
- Participation in other intervention studies
- Diagnosis of any other neurologic disease
- Malignancy within the past 2 years
- History of stroke
- History of brain surgery
- Hepatic insufficiency with liver function tests (LFTs) greater than 3 times upper limit of normal (ULN)
- Renal insufficiency requiring dialysis
- End stage cardiac failure
- Participation in a trial of a device, drug, or other therapy for ALS within 3 months of screening or during the trial

facility.name: Providence Brain and Spine Institute ALS Center

group.title: EPI-589
group.description: Participants received EPI-589 500 milligrams (mg) (2 tablets of 250 mg each) twice daily (BID) for 3 months, unless discontinued for safety or tolerability issues.

milestone.title: Received at Least 1 Dose of Study Drug

baseline.population: Efficacy intent-to-treat (EITT) population or safety population included any participant who received at least 1 dose of EPI-589.

group.title: EPI-589
group.description: Participants received EPI-589 500 mg (2 tablets of 250 mg each) BID for 3 months, unless discontinued for safety or tolerability issues.

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
Ethnicity (NIH/OMB)
Race (NIH/OMB)

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis Functional Rating Scale-Revised (ALSFRS-R) Score
measure.description: ALSFRS-R is a quickly administered (5 minutes) ordinal rating scale that assesses participant's capability and independence in 12 functional activities. All 12 activities, 6 bulbar-respiratory functions, 3 upper extremity functions (writing, cutting food, and dressing), 2 lower-extremity functions (walking and climbing), and 1 other function (turning in bed), are relevant in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS). Each activity was recorded to the closest approximation from a list of 5 choices, scored 0-4, with the total score ranging from 48 (normal function) to 0 (unable to attempt the task).

measure.title: Vital Capacity
measure.description: Vital capacity is the maximum amount of air a participant can expel from the lungs after a maximum inhalation.

measure.title: Maximum Inspiratory Pressure (MIP)
measure.description: MIP is a measure of the strength of inspiratory muscles, primarily the diaphragm, and allows for the assessment of ventilatory failure, restrictive lung disease, and respiratory muscle strength.

measure.title: Respiratory Rate
measure.description: Respiratory rate is the rate at which breathing occurs.
measure.population: 'Number analyzed' signifies participants evaluable for specified categories.

measure.title: Heart Rate
measure.description: The heart rate measures the number of times the heart beats per minute.
measure.population: 'Number analyzed' signifies participants evaluable for specified categories.

measure.title: Oxygen Saturation (SpO2)
measure.description: SpO2, also known as oxygen saturation, is a measure of the amount of oxygen-carrying hemoglobin in the blood relative to the amount of hemoglobin not carrying oxygen.
measure.population: 'Number analyzed' signifies participants evaluable for specified categories.

measure.title: End-Tidal Carbon Dioxide (ETCO2)
measure.description: ETCO2 is the amount of CO2 in exhaled air, which assesses ventilation.
measure.population: 'Number analyzed' signifies participants evaluable for specified categories.

measure.title: Average Solid Swallowing Time
Average Water Swallowing Time
Muscle Function, as Assessed by Handheld Dynamometry Parameters
measure.description: Handheld dynamometry parameters included grip strength, shoulder flexion, knee extension, hip flexion, elbow flexion, elbow extension, and ankle dorsi flexion.
measure.population: 'Number analyzed' signifies participants evaluable for specified categories.

measure.title: Number of Words Participant Read
Time Spent in Reading
Number of Words Per Minute Read

outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) was any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug without regard to possibility of causal relationship. Serious adverse event (SAE) was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes or deemed significant for any other reason: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly. AEs included both SAEs and non-serious AEs. A summary of other non-serious AEs and all SAEs, regardless of causality is located in the 'Reported AE section'.

group.title: EPI-589
group.description: Participants received EPI-589 500 mg (2 tablets of 250 mg each) BID for 3 months, unless discontinued for safety or tolerability issues.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Sponsor can review results and/or communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is up to 180 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor may consult with the PI to require changes to the communication or extend the embargo.
